Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that nine banks will be permanently closed by the RBI on the order of the Supreme Court, when in fact there is no truth to this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there are no relevant news reports or official statements to corroborate the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the information shared on WhatsApp is accurate and trustworthy, without any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the message circulating on WhatsApp is a rumor or misinformation, as clarified by the RBI and Finance Secretary Rajeev Kumar.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the RBI has stated that reports of closing down certain commercial banks are false.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting false information and failing to provide any credible sources or evidence.
